# Kipp & Zonen CMP Series Pyranometer

## Overview

The CMP Series pyranometer measures both total and diffuse shortwave irradiance across a broad spectral range, providing comprehensive solar radiation data.

## Key Features

- **Manufacturer**: Kipp & Zonen
- **Model**: CMP Series
- **Type**: Radiation Sensor (Pyranometer)
- **Deployment**: Wing-mounted, upper side

## Measured Variables

- Total shortwave irradiance (SW_IRRAD_TOTAL)
- Diffuse shortwave irradiance (SW_IRRAD_DIFFUSE)

## Specifications

| Parameter | Value |
|-----------|-------|
| Spectral Range | 285-2800 nm |
| Sensitivity | 5-20 µV/W/m² |
| Response Time | <5 s (95%) |
| Directional Error | <10 W/m² |

## Links

- [Manufacturer Product Page](https://www.kippzonen.com/Product/11/CMP-series)
- [Kipp & Zonen](https://www.kippzonen.com/)

## Deployment Notes

Mounted on the upper side of the Saildrone wing to measure incoming solar radiation. The sensor's broad spectral range captures UV through infrared radiation, essential for energy budget studies.
